alert.note: Alert for Elmore; Lowndes; Macon; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 4:00PM CDT until August 26 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing. * WHERE...A portion of Central Alabama, including the following counties, Autauga, Elmore, Lowndes, Macon and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 400 PM CDT, Doppler RADAR indicated heavy rain over the past 6 hours. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 3 and 5.5 inches of rain have fallen per RADAR estimates, as well as observer reports. - Areas around the City of Montgomery is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Montgomery, Prattville, Millbrook, Tuskegee, Tallassee, Hayneville, Milstead, Pike Road, White Hall, Shorter, Franklin, Lowndesboro, Mount Meigs, Auburn University In Montgomery, Waugh, Eastdale Mall, Emerald Mountain, Pinedale, Lagoon Park and Tysonville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
